summary.value: Calculated Ocean Emissivity using Remote Sensing Systems (RSS)surface model for AMSR2

keywords.value: EARTH SCIENCE > ATMOSPHERE > ATMOSPHERIC RADIATION > EMISSIVITY

title.value: Ocean Surface Emissivity calculated from ERA5 neutral stability winds on a 0.25 degree Earth grid, time interpolated to satellite overpass time

history.value: Created from ERA5 data downloaded from the Copernicus Climate Data Store using the RSS surface radiation model

reference.value: Meissner, T, FJ Wentz, 2012, The emissivity of the ocean surface between 6 - 90 GHz over a large range of wind speeds and Earth incidence angles, IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing, 50, 3004-3026.

source.value: (For Wind Data) Hersbach, H., Bell, B., Berrisford, P., Hirahara, S., Horányi, A., Muñoz-Sabater, J., et al. 2020). The ERA5 global reanalysis. Quarterly Journal of the Royal Meteorological Society, 146(730), 1999–2049. https://doi.org/10.1002/qj.3803. ERA5 hourly data on single levels from 1959 to present. Skin Temperature.25 degree x 0.25 degree gridded data downloaded from the Copernicus Climate Data Store. Dataset DOI: 10.24381/cds.adbb2d47

long_name.value: ocean emissivity derived from ERA5 surface winds
